intro: Jacea microptilon, commonly known as the narrow-leaved jacea, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, temperate environments and has a compact growth habit. Its botanical features include a short stem, aromatic foliage, and white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. It is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
